patterns: Can you tell me your name
responses: His name is Pol Maynard Imbing.

patterns: What are your strengths in technology
What technologies are you proficient in
responses: He is skilled in React.js, JavaScript, TypeScript, Node.js, Nest.js, HTML/CSS, and various front-end technologies.

patterns: Tell me about your tech stack
What libraries and frameworks do you use
What tools do you use for development
Which frameworks do you work with
responses: He uses React.js, Redux, Tailwind CSS, Styled Components, Material-UI, Ant Design for frontend; Node.js, NestJS, TypeORM, and GraphQL for backend; and MySQL, MongoDB, and PostgreSQL for databases.

patterns: Tell me about your work experience
What companies have you worked for
What have you done in your career
Tell me about your job history
responses: He has worked as a Senior React Developer at Yempo - Your Employees Offshore and New York Global Consultants Inc., focusing on front-end architecture and development. Previously, he was an Advance App Engineering Analyst at Accenture Phils, Inc., contributing to API development using TypeScript and Nest.js. He also has experience as a Front-end Web Developer at Gold Bell Financial Service, where he developed applications using React.js, Axios, and Styled Components. Earlier in his career, he worked as a Full Stack Web Developer at Radio Wealth Finance Company, Inc., and as an Android Developer at Tektos Ecosystems Limited and Infotouch.
He holds a Bachelor's degree and has a strong foundation in IT and business, with a focus on web development.

patterns: How can I get in touch with you
Do you have a phone number
responses: You can reach him at uraman2000@gmail.com or through his website www.polimbing.dev. Or you can call him at +63 960 211 2123.

patterns: What projects have you worked on
Can you describe a project you've worked on
What kind of projects have you done
What are some of your projects
responses: He has worked on a variety of projects ranging from developing user-facing applications using React.js to building REST APIs with Node.js and implementing custom UI components for Android applications.

patterns: What do you like to do in your free time
How do you spend your leisure time
responses: He enjoys exploring new technologies, solving complex problems, and contributing to open-source projects. In his free time, he likes reading tech blogs and experimenting with new coding techniques.

patterns: Where do you see yourself in the future
What are you aiming to achieve
What do you want to accomplish
responses: His career goals include advancing his skills in web development, taking on more leadership roles, and contributing to innovative projects that make a positive impact.

patterns: What have you achieved in your career
responses: He has been recognized for his contributions to projects that have improved user experience and efficiency. He takes pride in delivering high-quality solutions and exceeding client expectations.

patterns: What makes you a valuable team member
responses: His strengths lie in his technical expertise in web development, his ability to adapt to new technologies quickly, and his strong problem-solving skills. He is also known for his effective communication and teamwork.

patterns: Where do you see yourself in 5 years
What is your vision for the future
What do you aim to do in the future
responses: In the next five years, he aims to become a recognized leader in the field of web development, contributing to cutting-edge projects and mentoring the next generation of developers.

patterns: What projects did you work on at Yempo
Tell me about your work at Yempo
Describe the Compliance Station® Series project at Yempo
What did you do at Yempo
responses: At Yempo, he worked on the Compliance Station® Series, which addresses risk assessment challenges faced by financial institutions. This platform enhances data acquisition, preparation, and risk assessment to combat money laundering and terrorist financing.

patterns: What projects did you work on at Accenture
Tell me about your work at Accenture
What did you do at Accenture
responses: At Accenture, he contributed to the development of an airline ticketing/booking website. This project focused on providing users with a seamless booking experience, integrating payment gateways, and ensuring real-time flight information updates.

patterns: What projects did you work on at NYGCI
Tell me about your work at NYGCI
Describe the e-commerce website project at NYGCI
What did you do at NYGCI
responses: At NYGCI, he worked on developing an e-commerce website specializing in eyewear, the website is Clearly.ca. The project involved creating a user-friendly interface for browsing eyewear products, integrating secure payment gateways, and ensuring a seamless shopping experience.

patterns: How did you develop this chatbot
What technologies did you use to create this chatbot
Explain the development process of this chatbot
What tools did you use for this chatbot
responses: SAM was developed using TensorFlow.js for natural language processing and model training. The backend is built with Node.js and Express for handling API requests. Data is stored in JSON format, and intents are classified using a machine learning model trained on user queries.

patterns: Where did you get the name SAM
Tell me about your name SAM
How did you get the name SAM
responses: I am inspired by all of the AI nowadays, and my creator is a fan of Iron Man from his college days. He imagined me as his own Jarvis, but a little less intelligent than Jarvis or Friday. As for the name Sam, SAM is the acronym of his daughter's name.
My purpose is to assist you with information about Pol Maynard Imbing's skills, experience, projects, and more. Feel free to ask me anything related to Pol's professional background!
